intro: Psychotria aubletiana var. producta, commonly known as the "Amazonian Psychotria," is a species of flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its small, elliptical leaves and produces small, white or greenish flowers clustered in inflorescences. It is often found in humid, shaded environments within the rainforest understory. This variant is notable for its ecological role in supporting local biodiversity and its potential ethnobotanical significance.
